comprehensive_overview: Coverage is a tool used to measure the extent to which the source code of a program has been tested. It is often used in software development to assess the quality and thoroughness of testing by determining which parts of the code have been executed during testing.
core_features: Measures code coverage to evaluate the effectiveness of test suites
Identifies parts of the code that have not been tested
Helps developers understand the quality of their testing efforts
Can be used to improve test coverage and identify potential gaps in testing
